intro: Xenophontia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant has feathery, finely divided leaves and thrives in coastal environments. Xenophontia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
